oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sam Davis Monument

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monuments; Trees
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Statue memorial of Sam Davis. Monument shows white stone statue of Sam Davis standing with his arms crossed atop a stone monument with an inscription on the base.
The statue was erected in 1910 by the United Daughters of the Confederacy in the town of Pulaski, where Sam Davis was hanged.
